title: The substance of a sermon, being an incouragement for Protestants or a happy prospect of glorious success: with exhortations to be valiant against our enemies, in opposing the bloody principle of papists, and errors of popery, &c. Occasionally on the Protestants victory over the French and Irish papists before London-Derry, in raising that desperate siege. By Mr. Walker minister, and governor of the city.
author: Walker, George, of Londonderry.
publicationStmtPublisher: printed by A. Milbourn in Green-Arbour-Court in the Little-Old-Baily,
